channel.title: Abstract help
channel.description: ok any player can do ::noclip also follow to get through walls etc please help

item.title: Abstract help
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

Kidpaparoach:

The one the OP used ;o. Running through waaalls is bad xD.

As I have previous explained, he can secure his client by utilizing a proper UID checking system, and therefore reject most cheat clients. Additionally, he will have to remove the noclip command client sided. If he can’t do that. Well, too bad for him.

Read full topic

item.title: Abstract help
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:3, topic:433832”][quote author=whackatre link=topic=536550.msg3922856#msg3922856 date=1329903109]
I thought you meant abstract classes.

Umm. Yea. I even place a noclip button for anyone to mess around with. Players love it.

In your client, remove the command in your client class. And enforce your client.
[/quote]
Sorry, I’m a bit stupid but what do you mean by enforce your client? Also, doesn’t this mean if its not stopped server sided to players can just put the cmd back in?[/quote]

What CMD? What benefits the players by viewing the outputted messages from the client?

Enforcing your client basically means preventing the other clients from connecting. A UID check is not the best way but definately prevents many from entering your server. Custom login protocol also helps (I use both of these methods).

Unless you have a system that clips players server-sided, you can almost always noclip. The serversided block where the server autobans them if they type the command “noclip” is incredibly retarded. What if they modify the command to be “noklip”? What now? Server’s fucked!

A good example of a server that did not enforce clients was Project Catastrophe in which I used my own client to mess around with everyone via noclip. Those were the fun days.

I like the noclip function and that is why I have a huge button on the top of the client which anyone can freely explore the 317 world.

Read full topic
